law.catch_line: Boarding of guest in private home presumed gratuitous.
law.text: Any person who without an agreement for compensation entertains another in his house or furnishes him with meals or storage for his goods shall be considered as doing it as a courtesy and shall not recover anything therefor, unless the person so entertaining or furnishing is a hotel proprietor or one who makes a practice of furnishing lodging or meals to others for compensation.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 2178, 2179.
